title: How to Make Brazil Nut Dip

steps.headline: Place the Brazil nuts into a bowl of water.
steps.description: Ensure that the water covers them.

steps.headline: Leave them to soak overnight or for 12 hours.
Place the soaked nuts into a food processor or blender.
Add the garlic, brewer's yeast and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Process or blend the ingredients, and continuing processing until the Brazil nuts are ground to a fine consistency.
Add water gradually to the dip mixture, then process or blend a little, give it a rest, then process or blend a little more.
Add the olive oil and process again until smooth.
Transfer the dip to a serving container and serve it with raw vegetables, such as carrot sticks, celery sticks and pieces of cauliflower.

text: Preparing the Brazil Nuts Place the Brazil nuts into a bowl of water. Ensure that the water covers them. Leave them to soak overnight or for 12 hours.  Drain before using.  Making the Dip Place the soaked nuts into a food processor or blender.  Add the garlic, brewer's yeast and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste.  Process or blend the ingredients, and continuing processing until the Brazil nuts are ground to a fine consistency.  Add water gradually to the dip mixture, then process or blend a little, give it a rest, then process or blend a little more.  Add the olive oil and process again until smooth.  Transfer the dip to a serving container and serve it with raw vegetables, such as carrot sticks, celery sticks and pieces of cauliflower.
